Attachments: 2014-08-28T15-02 [summit.sharma@collabera.com] Job Opportunity from Collabera for Web Developer – III (ITEKJP00003429): Hillsboro OR - TalentSource Candidate Representation Agreement.doc.doc.doc
Email Text:
Hello Theodore,

This is Summit from Collabera and I am writing to you regarding an excellent job
opportunity that I have with one of Collabera's premier clients in Hillsboro OR.
I found your resume during my search for qualified candidates on internet and
would like to know if you would be interested to pursue this opportunity.

To know more about Collabera, please visit us on www.collabera.com.

Please acknowledge me on the information shared below:

Position Details:

Industry:        Intel
Location:        Hillsboro OR
Job Title:       Web Developer – III (ITEKJP00003429)
Duration:        6 Months
                 Project Description: Develops, rewrites, and prepares
                 modifications to Intel Customer Support websites. These
                 include: - iKnow; an external and internal facing web
                 application and content management system for Intel product
                 support articles. - Download Center; a customer facing data
                 driven .NET web application where customers go to query for and
                 download files to support Intel products. - Download Center
                 Manager; an internal facing data driven .NET web application
                 where customers go to upload content files to support Intel
                 products. Daily Responsibilities: Developers will be involved
                 in reviewing current design and working with the technical lead
                 to define future design, document, review, develop, test, and
Job Description: implement product. They must be experienced and proficient with
                 Microsoft Visual Studio 2012/2013 (knowledge of prior versions
                 a plus), C#, ASP.NET MVC 4, and Test Driven Development. They
                 should be experienced and proficient in T-SQL queries, stored
                 procedures, functions, relational database modeling, and SSIS
                 packages. It is also beneficial to be experienced and
                 proficient with core web technologies including HTML 5,
                 JavaScript, JQuery, AJAX, and JSON. It is also beneficial to
                 have experience with HTML templating engines like Handlebars or
                 Mustache. REQUIRED SKILLS - Manager looking for advanced
                 experience in these skills (5+ years exp) C# .NET 4.5 ASP.NET
                 MVC 4 HTML 5 CSS 3 JQUERY T-SQL SQL Server Management A
                 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field

Pre-Employment Questions:

If you would like to pursue this position, please reply to this e-mail and
provide us details in following areas. Also, please attach a copy of your
updated resume, in word format, elaborating your projects in tune with the
client’s requirement. This will assist us in placing you with one of our
clients.

(then When)?

If yes, please explain and provide details:

Note: Do not include convictions that have been annulled, erased, expunged,
vacated, set aside, sealed by a court, or referred to a diversion program.
Conviction of a crime will not necessarily disqualify you from employment.
Factors such as age at the time of the offense, seriousness and nature of the
violation, and rehabilitation will be considered when making employment
decisions. A conviction record will not necessarily be a bar to employment.

accommodation? (Please answer ‘No accommodation is needed’ or ‘Yes,
accommodation(s) is/ are needed)’.

discussing this opportunity in detail or incase an interview is scheduled?

Subject: Shiftwise Technical Phone Screen Confirmation
Attachments: 2015-01-29T14-48 [elovely@mbg.com] Shiftwise Technical Phone Screen Confirmation - ShiftWise Core Values.docx
Email Text:
Hey Ted,

You are confirmed for a phone screen with Shiftwise Monday 2/2 at 2:00pm. I have
attached Shiftwise core values for you to look over along with the following.

Hello, and thanks for your interest in ShiftWise!

Job interviews can be stressful. We want your experience with ShiftWise to be
positive, so we’ve compiled this guide to help you prepare. This gives everyone
the best opportunity to see if ShiftWise is a good match for your skills,
experience, work preferences, goals, and personality.

Every candidate we hire goes through at least two separate interviews: A
technical phone screen and an in-person interview. The sections that follow
explain these interviews. They tell you what you can expect and provide tips on
how best to prepare.

The attachment is a list of traits that we value. It should help to give you an
idea of what’s important to us and what we’re looking for in potential new
coworkers.

The Technical Phone Screen

Every candidate starts out with a technical phone screen. A member of our team
will call you at a prearranged date and time and ask you a series of questions
about the technologies we use.

The purpose of this interview is to assess your technical skills and experience
in a variety of areas. The subject areas covered will depend on the job, but
will correspond to the desired skills listed in the job description. Be sure to
ask your recruiter if you have any questions.

All technical screens use a predetermined list of questions, but we will also
ask follow-up questions based on your responses. This adaptive interviewing
technique helps us assess the depth and breadth of your knowledge, but it also
helps you by giving you a chance to really shine in areas where you’re
particularly strong.

These interviews take anywhere from fifteen to forty-five minutes to complete
depending on the role, the level of experience desired, and the answers
provided. At the end of the interview, we provide you an opportunity to ask us
questions about ShiftWise, our teams, the role you’re applying for, and the way
we work.

Tips:

·         Be sure to confirm the day and time with your recruiter in advance.

·         Be ready! Make sure your phone is charged, has a good signal, and find
a quiet area where you won’t be interrupted or distracted.

·         The best course of study for the technical phone screen is your
experience and/or education up to this point.  Refresh your knowledge as you
feel necessary, but don’t over-prepare.

·         Don’t use search engines to look up answers during the interview.  It
doesn’t help—and trust me, we can tell!

·         Be factual and objective in your responses. Don’t try to give us “the
answer we want”. Tell us what you know and what you think.

·         If you don’t know an answer, be willing to venture a reasonable guess.
That gives us a chance to discuss and reason through the topic . If someone
responds with a flat “I don’t know”, there’s nowhere we can go from there.

·         Don’t worry if you get some questions “wrong”: Everyone does!  We’ve
never turned away a candidate just because they didn’t know one specific fact

·         Come prepared with questions for us!

Please give me a call after the interview. 503.688.1918

Good Luck,

Eric Lovely

Staffing Manager

Mainz Brady Group, Inc

2701 Vaughn Street, Ste 456

Portland, OR 97210

Office: (503) 688-1918

r Mobile: (360) 606-1460

r  Email:  elovely@mbg.com

------ Attachment ShiftWise Core Values.docx -----
                                          ShiftWise Core Values
              The list of traits below summarize our Core Values here at ShiftWise. They
              convey what matters to us, what we admire and respect in others. Viewed as a
              whole, they describe the kind of people we want to hire, the people we enjoy
              working with.
              Note that these are things we value. It’s not meant to imply that every one of
              us possesses all ten in abundance. We all have room to grow.
              Also, the terms aren’t listed in any particular order. They’re not organized by
              importance or rank.

      Flexibility: We want to work with other people who are flexible. They’re willing to take on a many
                   different kinds of tasks. They aren’t put off by occasional changes in priority, direction, or
                   process. They don’t need everyone to work or communicate the exact same way they do.
    Persistence: We want to work with other people who are self-motivated to carry their work through to
                 completion. They don’t abandon tasks. They don’t let small issues stop them. They find
                 ways to work around or through issues without compromising goals. They also know when
                 to quit, when to consider alternatives, when to seek help.
       Integrity: We want to work with other people who are trustworthy. Given a task, we can leave them
                  to their work. We don’t have to check up on them to make sure they aren’t circumventing
                  our established practices and methods or lying about where they’re spending their time.
      Discipline: We want to work with other people who are disciplined. They apply a great deal of care to
                  their work in all its details. They don’t shirk valuable practices just because they seem
                  uninteresting or inconvenient. They understand the powerful and positive overall effect of
                  applying diligence in many small things.
       Empathy: We want to work with other people who honestly and openly seek to understand the values
                and viewpoints of others. They aren’t entirely self-serving. They know that their decisions
                impact a wider audience and act accordingly. They’re better able to navigate conflict &
                negotiate solutions because they put themselves in others’ shoes.
Self-Awareness: We want to work with people who know themselves well, who know their own strengths
                and weaknesses. They aren’t over-confident, but neither are they obsequious. They know
                what they need in order to succeed.
Being Proactive: We want to work with other people who have initiative. They promote their ideas and can
                 defend them with facts and reason. They seek out opportunities to make continuous
                 improvements. It’s important to note, though, that being proactive doesn’t mean they try to
                 do everything themselves.
 Self-Improving: The people we want to work with want to grow. They don’t just want to be great at what
                 they do, they want to be better: better than they were last month, last week, or just better
                 than they were yesterday. They value and practice continuous self-education. They’re
                 honest and open about the mistakes they’ve made and use them as opportunities to
                 improve themselves and benefit others.
Communication: We want to work with other people who are effective communicators. This doesn’t just
               mean that they write clear emails or can speak in public (though those are valuable skills). It
               means that they can read and respect individual communication styles and preferences.
               They’re aware of their audience and adjust their message appropriately. They don’t hoard
               information, but neither do they broadcast their every thought or idea.
         Talent: We want to work with people who excel at what they do. Those with long experience will
                 have built up a broad, deep arsenal of skills. Those lacking experience more than make up
                 for it by their intuition and raw ability

------ End of attachment -----

Subject: Requirement for SQL DBA
Attachments: 2015-02-09T12-20 [imtiaz@indowelshcompany.com] Requirement for SQL DBA - CANDIDATE DETAIL FORM.doc
Email Text:
ROLE:  SQL DBA
Salem, OR
12 Months

REQUIRED SKILLS:

•           6 years of SQL Server experience.
•           SQL Server 2012 configuration and cluster installation
•           Experience as a MS SQL development/administrator on large scale
software development project.
•           Must have experience with replication, and SQL Always-on
configuration
•           Experience with applying service packs, backups and restore
•           Monitor SQL server performance, utilization, usage of DMV queries to
performance tune SQL scripts
•           Must have worked hand in hand with developers.
•           Must have experience in troubleshooting complex SQL stored
procedures and queries.
•           Must have experience in writing complex SQL queries.
•           Must have experience in developing and troubleshooting SSIS
packages.
•           Education: Baccalaureate or graduate degree (MS, MA, PhD) from an
accredited college/university in computer science, computer engineering, or
comparable area of study.  If substituting an area of study other than computer
science or computer engineering, include substantiation for equivalence.
•           Minimum 1 year experience with MS-Reporting Services (SSRS)..
•           Minimum 1 year experience with MS-Integration Services (SSIS).
•           Strong Analytical Skills
•           Good communication skills

DESIRED SKILLS:

•           It is desirable that the Database Designer has experience working
with MS SQL Server [Siva] 2012 cluster including database schema design,
optimization, SQL development, failover, replication, XML, meta-data for a
period of one (1) year or more.
•           It is desirable that the Database Designer has a current Microsoft
Certified Database Administrator (MCDBAs) Certification.
•           Familiarity with SQL reporting server configuration and security
provisioning
•           Current certification for Practitioner’s or Manager’s Certificate in
ITIL IT Services Management.

RESPONSIBILITIES/EXPECTED DELIVERABLES:

•           SQL Server administration , configuration and support large scale
development team
•           Releasing database scripts to development and QA testing
environments.
•           Proficient in backup and restores duties.
•           Working and co-coordinating with Developers to do weekly builds.
•           Do database code reviews.
•           Create data dictionary and maintain database baselines.
•           Help developers in developing SSRS reports.
•           Creating, maintaining, and optimizing database objects (e.g. views,
catalogs, and triggers).

The Database Administrator shall at a minimum meet the Mandatory Requirements
defined below and as many of the Desirable Requirements as possible.
Thanks and Regards,

Mohd.Imtiaz
149 Madison Ave, Suite 1139,
New York, NY 10016
T: 917-965-8169
F: 917-746-9292
imtiaz@indowelshcompany.com

Subject: Interview Confirmation- Senior .Net Developer -Greater Giving
Email Text:
Hi Ted,

You are confirmed for an onsite interview on Monday, November 23^rd at 9:00 AM
at Greater Giving – 1920 NW Amberglen Pkwy #140, Hillsboro, OR 97124.

My Account Manager, Jessica Addicks,  will meet you in the main lobby of the
building at 8:45 AM to walk you in and introduce you to the hiring manager. If
you have any problems at all getting to your interview or finding the location-
please give my Account Manager a call on her cell at (713) 703-2647.

You will be meeting with Mark Allen, who is the Manager of Software Quality
Assurance at Greater Giving. This will be comprehensive interview focusing on
your software engineering background and most recent work experience; however
you should also be prepared to discuss your interest in this role, as well as
your strong desire to work for Greater Giving.

Best of luck - we thank you in advance for representing us well and look forward
                           to hearing from you soon.

   PLEASE REPLY TO THIS EMAIL SO I KNOW YOU’VE RECEIVED IT AND ARE CONFIRMED.

                     Senior .Net Developer/ Greater Giving

MUST HAVES

-          5+ years with SQL, ASP.NET, and JavaScript

-          Agile Experience

-          Working knowledge of APIs (REST or SOAP)

DAY 2 DAY

Our client is looking for a senior .NET developer who will help to create new
software products, modules, and features as well as maintain existing software
products and services. This is a very collaborative environment, and this client
will contribute to the product specification process, as well as draft
documentation for development projects.

Greater Giving- Overview

Greater Giving works exclusively with schools and nonprofits across the nation —
offering integrated technologies to help simplify event management; quickly
train volunteers; streamline check-in and check-out; and raise more funds.
Greater Giving solutions are based on a single platform, are user-friendly, and
will simplify your job. Greater Giving Partners include over 100 professional
benefit auctioneers, event planners & consultants, and technology services to
choose from—with our stamp of approval. Built on a foundation of trust and
through leadership, Greater Giving’s extensive community reach is unparalleled
in the industry. We give back to nonprofits with ongoing educational resources
and webinars; fundraising guides; engaging social media and blog posts; LinkedIn
and Facebook user groups; our Thought Leadership Summit and Giving Tuesday
campaign.

Best Wishes,

Sarah Hershberger | Insight Global

I hope you had a great Thanksgiving weekend! I just want to touch bases with you
and see how your job search has been going. I just had a couple Senior level
Software Engineer positions open up that I thought you would be an excellent fit
for. One of these roles is with Jeppesen and is located in Wilsonville, and the
other position  is with Banfield Pet Hospital and is located in Vancouver-
listed below are job descriptions.

Please let me know what your thoughts are. I look forward to hearing from you
soon. Thanks Ted and I hope you’re having a great day so far!

Duration:            9 month contract – possible extensions

Locations:           Wilsonville, OR

Develops, documents and maintains architectures, requirements, algorithms,
interfaces and designs for
software systems. With general direction, contributes to the design,
development, documentation and
maintenance of software systems. Participates in internal and external
architecture and design reviews.
Develops Computer Software Units (CSUs) software requirements and algorithms.
Defines internal
interfaces. Performs requirements allocation between hardware, software, and
operators. Participates in
requirement team and peer reviews as a presenter and evaluator. Performs
requirements change
assessment and provides a technical interface to requirement change-assessment
meetings. Develops,
maintains and unit tests code by utilizing software development environments and
programming
languages in order to implement design and satisfy allocated requirements.

walkthroughs. Has experience with the Agile development process.

-       SOA

-       Sonar

-       Perforce incl Branch & Merge Strategy

-       Contour

-       Enterprise Architect

-       JIRA

-       Coded UI

OTHER:

-       SDLC

-       Enterprise Software Design

-       Design Patterns

-       Software Documentation

-       Agile or Iterative Development

-       Team Collaboration

-       Unit Testing

               Full Stack .NET Developer / Banfield Pet Hospital

6 month contract

Vancouver, WA

-Bachelor's degree in Computer Science preferred, or the equivalent combination
of education, training.
-Proficient in Angular
-Proficient in HTML5
-Minimum four years programming with the following experience required:
.Net framework 3.5, C#, Winforms, XML, ASP.Net, WCF, Unit Test (Moq),
Understanding of iterative software development lifecycle methodology such as
Agile, Scrum and RUP Object Oriented Design/Development.
-Working knowledge of MS SQL Server 2008 preferred.
-Be able to work with pets â€“ most employees bring their pets to work
-Good team player- these guys are a very tight nit group

Plusses

etc.).

Day-to-Day

-Participate in the design and development of the source system application.
programming languages and advanced tools to analyze applications containing

support for business application systems development and enhancement.

significant business impact.

-Adherence to policies, procedures, standards.
-Report on project schedules and estimates.

    From: Theodore Seeber [mailto:seebert42@gmail.com]
    Sent: Tuesday, January 19, 2016 1:38 PM
    To: Mamta V M
    Subject: Re: Job opportunity--Sr. Software Engineer-- 4 months-- Beaverton,
    OR

    Here is my resume

    On Tue, Jan 19, 2016 at 1:37 PM, Mamta V M <mamtavm@aditistaffing.com>
    wrote:

      Hi,

      Greeting from Aditi Staffing!

      I am Mamta from Aditi Staffing – Aditi Staffing is a contingent staffing
      firm with  a strong technology heritage. After reviewing your resume, I
      believe that you would be a good fit for the below job opportunity with
      one of our direct clients. Listed below are some more details about the
      position.

      Job Role : Sr. Software Engineer

      Duration: 4+ months

      Location: Beaverton, OR

      Experience:

      As a Sr. Software Engineer you will:

      •             Leverage your love of Java/Scala to design and build the new
      breed of micro services .

      •             Build on your knowledge of horizontally scalable
      Dynamo-style databases such as Cassandra and Riak, to ensure we have
      reliable, highly-available and high-performance data

      •             Review teammates technical designs, code and tests to keep
      the entire team focused on being the best they can be

      •             Harness your DevOps skills to automate your service
      deployments so they’re fully repeatable. Experience using
      Puppet/Chef/Saltstack/Ansible is a plus

      •             Build your components for Continuous Delivery

      •             Profile and performance tune your work to ensure we deliver
      the fastest web experience to all customers across the globe

      •             Partner with other architects and teams to ensure the
      ecosystem of services stay consistent, loosely coupled and independently
      scalable

      •             Automate the testing of all of your components to ensure we
      have excellent test coverage with quality assertions

      We're looking for someone special, someone who had these experiences and
      clearly demonstrated these skills:

      •                    Minimum 5 years’ experience building high volume,
      high availability Java applications (required)

      •                    Experience writing automated tests using tools like
      JUnit, ScalaTest, Spock or Specs

      •                    Experience with applications hosted in Amazon Web
      Services AWS (preferred)

      •                    Experience building RESTful APIs (preferred)

      •                    Experience working with highly concurrent systems
      (Highly desired)

      •                    Experience with Scala, Akka and related projects
      (Bonus!)

      •                    5 years directly relevant work experience as a
      software engineer with growth

      •                    Excellent analytical, written and oral communication
      skills

      •                    Strong working knowledge of basic computer science
      data structures and algorithms

      Education:

      •                    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information
      Systems, or other relevant field

      •                    2 years of additional relevant professional
      experience accepted in lieu of a degree

      Thanks and Regards,

      Mamta.V.M

      Technical Recruiter

      D:+1 269-430-3678

      mamtavm@aditistaffing.com

      Connect with Us: LinkedIn | Facebook | Twitter | YouTube | Glassdoor

  at Greater Giving – 1920 NW Amberglen Pkwy #140, Hillsboro, OR 97124.

  building at 8:45 AM to walk you in and introduce you to the hiring manager. If
  you have any problems at all getting to your interview or finding the
  location- please give my Account Manager a call on her cell at (713) 703-2647.

                     Senior .Net Developer/ Greater Giving

  -          5+ years with SQL, ASP.NET, and JavaScript

  -          Agile Experience

  -          Working knowledge of APIs (REST or SOAP)

  DAY 2 DAY

  Our client is looking for a senior .NET developer who will help to create new
  software products, modules, and features as well as maintain existing software
  products and services. This is a very collaborative environment, and this
  client will contribute to the product specification process, as well as draft
  documentation for development projects.

  Greater Giving works exclusively with schools and nonprofits across the nation
  — offering integrated technologies to help simplify event management; quickly
  train volunteers; streamline check-in and check-out; and raise more funds.

  and will simplify your job. Greater Giving Partners include over 100
  professional benefit auctioneers, event planners & consultants, and technology
  services to choose from—with our stamp of approval. Built on a foundation of
  trust and through leadership, Greater Giving’s extensive community reach is
  unparalleled in the industry. We give back to nonprofits with ongoing
  educational resources and webinars; fundraising guides; engaging social media
  and blog posts; LinkedIn and Facebook user groups; our Thought Leadership
  Summit and Giving Tuesday campaign.

------ Attachment GV Job Des-SW ENG-Sr.docx -----
Senior Software Engineer JOB DESCRIPTION
Engineering/Summit

General Job Details
System Job Code/Title:     Software Engineer III
Job Title:                 Senior Software Engineer

Organization Level 1:      Video Systems
Organization Level 2:      Server (Summit, Dyno)
Reports to:                Mark Hillebrandt
Office Location:           Hillsboro, Oregon

Job Summary
Grass Valley is a developer and supplier of professional video solutions around the world. As a member
of the engineering team you will be on the leading edge of using emerging technology into new
solutions for production, storage and distribution of digital media to the world. The successful
candidate will have a deep understanding of software development and a passion for finding new
technology to produce high performance and robust products. You will help define future server
solutions for the company and be part of an agile team to implement them.

Job Tasks
    •   Work closely with Product Management, Marketing and Engineering teams to research, define
        and develop product architectures, designs and plans for server solutions
    •   Work closely with development teams to implement server solutions and improve existing
        products
    •   Create design document and conduct design review with design team members
    •   Fast prototyping of new product concepts

Required Skills & Competencies
    •   Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience. Advanced degree
        and experience a plus.
    •   10+ years of industry experience.
    •   Strong programming skills in C++.
    •   Extensive system software development experience in VxWorks, Linux, or Windows.
    •   Experience debugging complex large-scale systems and applications on Windows platforms.
    •   Strong understanding in multithread, event driven, asynchronous IO programming models.
    •   Knowledge of high level hardware architectures and comfortable working on low-level
        interfaces.
    •   In-depth knowledge of performance analysis and modeling techniques, tools and benchmarking.
    •   Excellent communication skills
    •   Ability to work in a team environment and also work independently.
    •   Ability to complete tasks on time with and without supervision.
    •   Demonstrated technical leadership.
Senior Software Engineer JOB DESCRIPTION
Engineering/Summit

Additional Qualifications
   •   Have experience with ftp and streaming formats like MXF, or MOV a big plus.
   •   Windows driver development experience is a big plus.
   •   Understanding of real-time programming concepts.
   •   Knowledge of C#.

Internal Interactions
This position will work together with software engineers, hardware engineers, product owners and
other agile team members across multiple product lines.

External Interactions
This position may have opportunities to gather requirements directly from customers and investigate 3rd
party solutions. Some travel is possible.

------ End of attachment -----

attachment: Job description for the full-time Senior Software Engineer role

Subject: RE: Interview Confirmation- Senior .Net Developer -Greater Giving
Email Text:
Hi Ted,

I apologize- we have a couple openings at Grass Valley Software Engineering
opening- this is the position that aligns better with your background. Please
let me know if you have any questions. Thanks so much!

                       Software Engineer JOB DESCRIPTION

Engineering/Summit/Dyno

General Job Details

System Job Code/Title:         Software Engineer II

Job Title:                           Software Engineer

Organization Level 1:              Video Systems

Organization Level 2:              Server (Summit, Dyno)

Office Location:                        Hillsboro, Oregon

Job Summary

Grass Valley is a developer and supplier of professional video solutions around
the world. This software engineer has direct involvement in the main aspects of
the software development lifecycle. The role involves close collaboration with
the other groups in the company in order to deliver high quality solutions to
our customers.

Job Tasks

•        Design, implement and test software, ensuring specifications and
requirements are met

•        Participate actively in design and code reviews

•        Share code and knowledge with development teams at other sites

•        Participate in team-directed planning sessions for development
iterations

•        Prepare, utilize, and maintain unit tests to verify developed
functionality

Required Skills & Competencies

·         Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
and 3-5 years of relevant work experience

·         Experience developing software in C++, C#/Java, and Visual Studio or
equivalent

·         Experience debugging complex large-scale systems and applications on
Windows platforms

·         Experience debugging multithreaded applications on Windows platforms

·         Excellent written and verbal communication skills

·         Ability to work in a team environment and also work independently

·         Ability to complete tasks on time with and without supervision

Additional Qualifications

·         Experience working with broadcast video a significant plus

·         Experience writing unit tests with NUnit, Visual Studio, or equivalent

·         Knowledge of client-server protocols

·         Experience developing in a Linux or VxWorks environment

·         Experience in Web Services, REST, and Service Oriented Architecture
(SOA) design

Internal Interactions

This position will work together with software engineers, hardware engineers,
product owners and other agile team members across multiple product lines.

Best Wishes,

  Hi Ted,

  opening- this is the position that aligns better with your background. Please
  let me know if you have any questions. Thanks so much!

                       Software Engineer JOB DESCRIPTION

  Engineering/Summit/Dyno

General Job Details

  System Job Code/Title:         Software Engineer II

  Job Title:                           Software Engineer

  Organization Level 1:              Video Systems

  Organization Level 2:              Server (Summit, Dyno)

  Office Location:                        Hillsboro, Oregon

Job Summary

  Grass Valley is a developer and supplier of professional video solutions
  around the world. This software engineer has direct involvement in the main
  aspects of the software development lifecycle. The role involves close
  collaboration with the other groups in the company in order to deliver high
  quality solutions to our customers.

Job Tasks

  •        Design, implement and test software, ensuring specifications and
  requirements are met

  •        Participate actively in design and code reviews

  •        Share code and knowledge with development teams at other sites

  •        Participate in team-directed planning sessions for development
  iterations

  •        Prepare, utilize, and maintain unit tests to verify developed
  functionality

Required Skills & Competencies

  ·         Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or Computer
  Engineering and 3-5 years of relevant work experience

  ·         Experience developing software in C++, C#/Java, and Visual Studio or
  equivalent

  ·         Experience debugging complex large-scale systems and applications on
  Windows platforms

  ·         Experience debugging multithreaded applications on Windows platforms

  ·         Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  ·         Ability to work in a team environment and also work independently

  ·         Ability to complete tasks on time with and without supervision

Additional Qualifications

  ·         Experience working with broadcast video a significant plus

  ·         Experience writing unit tests with NUnit, Visual Studio, or
  equivalent

  ·         Knowledge of client-server protocols

  ·         Experience developing in a Linux or VxWorks environment

  ·         Experience in Web Services, REST, and Service Oriented Architecture
  (SOA) design

Internal Interactions

  This position will work together with software engineers, hardware engineers,
  product owners and other agile team members across multiple product lines.

  Best Wishes,

      (713) 703-2647.

                     Senior .Net Developer/ Greater Giving

      MUST HAVES

      -          5+ years with SQL, ASP.NET, and JavaScript

      -          Agile Experience

      -          Working knowledge of APIs (REST or SOAP)

      DAY 2 DAY

      Our client is looking for a senior .NET developer who will help to create
      new software products, modules, and features as well as maintain existing
      software products and services. This is a very collaborative environment,
      and this client will contribute to the product specification process, as
      well as draft documentation for development projects.

      Greater Giving- Overview

      Greater Giving works exclusively with schools and nonprofits across the
      nation — offering integrated technologies to help simplify event
      management; quickly train volunteers; streamline check-in and check-out;
      and raise more funds. Greater Giving solutions are based on a single
      platform, are user-friendly, and will simplify your job. Greater Giving
      Partners include over 100 professional benefit auctioneers, event planners
      & consultants, and technology services to choose from—with our stamp of
      approval. Built on a foundation of trust and through leadership, Greater
      Giving’s extensive community reach is unparalleled in the industry. We
      give back to nonprofits with ongoing educational resources and webinars;
      fundraising guides; engaging social media and blog posts; LinkedIn and
      Facebook user groups; our Thought Leadership Summit and Giving Tuesday
      campaign.

Subject: Interview Confirmation for Friday the 19th at 4:30 - Cascade Corporation
Email in PDF: /Emails/All/2016-02-16-Interview Confirmation for Friday the 19th at 4:30 - Cascade Corporation.pdf
Email Text:
Hi Ted!

Congratulations on securing an onsite interview with Cascade Corporation, Friday
the 19^th at 4:30pm

Please give my account manager, Sara Boraston, a call when you are getting close
as GPS doesn’t take you all the way there.

Her number is 831-247-4448

Location: 2201 NE 201st Ave, Fairview, OR 97204

Be sure to research the company’s website at https://www.cascorp.com/. Please
bring something to write with and be professionally dressed, also, be sure to
speak loudly, clearly, confidently, and concisely. Show your personality do your
best to build rapport. It’s important to remember that 90% of interviews are
based on personality, so be yourself! Let your confidence shine through and
above all, be upbeat about the opportunity. Skills can be taught, personality
cannot!

Please also be sure to answer all of the managers questions, but also make sure
you have all of your questions answered as well. Lastly, be sure to thank the
manager for their time. I know much of this is common etiquette, but you’d be
surprised how many people we work with that forget the small things, so I tend
to over-communicate J

Good luck and give me a call at the office after the interview.  I look forward
to hearing how it went!

Best of luck - we thank you in advance for representing us well and look forward
                           to hearing from you soon.

   PLEASE REPLY TO THIS EMAIL SO I KNOW YOU’VE RECEIVED IT AND ARE CONFIRMED.

Best Regards,

Subject: Rate confirmation for Theodore M. Seeber  for .NET Developer | Hillsboro, OR | 6+ Months | Phone/Skype | USC,GC,GC-EAD only
Email in PDF: /Emails/All/2016-03-22-Rate confirmation for Theodore M. Seeber  for .NET Developer | Hillsboro, OR | 6+ Months | Phone_Skype | USC,GC,GC-EAD only.pdf
Email Text:
Hello,

It was pleasure talking to you.

Rate Confirmation:-

It was a pleasure talking with you just now, As we spoke please confirm the
discussed rate $45/hr on W2 as we agreed for your consultant Theodore M. Seeber
for this below mentioned position for /// NET Developer /// Hillsboro, OR /// 6+
months ///

Job Title: .NET Developer

Job Location: Hillsboro, OR

Duration: 6+ Months
Mode of Interview: Phone then Skype

End Client: Harman

USC,GC,GC-EAD only

Manager has interviewed a couple of candidates and found them lacking in the
following areas:

·         SQL - very little to no experience and no experience with XML Handling

·        .Net C# - some experience either in SOAP service or REST service but
not both. Both are required

·         Java script: Basic skill on the Java script; not much experience on
the JSON, browser agnostic coding

·         While this is a level II position, candidates should have at least 2
years of solid experience in the above and be able to talk to those skills
strongly.

·         Manager is looking through rest of resumes for matches, but also
opening to additional.

Job Description:

This position will design and develop ASP.NET and C# software for a three-tier,
highly available enterprise web applications. The ideal candidate will work as
part of a talented and collaborative team functioning in an agile methodology
that closely follows Scrum. This position requires a candidate who is
self-disciplined, motivated and wants to make a difference.

We are seeking a software engineer with 2 to 3 years of experience in .NET
development with a proven track record in authoring high-quality software. We
are seeking qualified candidates who can work with the latest tools and
technologies such as C#, .NET 4.0, ASP.NET, HTML5, JS, IIS, WCF, Visual Studio
2015, Windows Server 2008 and Subversion/GIT. Selenium Browser Automation
experience a must!

Key Responsibilities:-

·         Design, develop, document, author and integrate software in a large
enterprise application

·         Implement unit tests and automated integration tests

·         Deploy and test software on a continuous integration environment

·         Understand software refactoring principles and apply them to existing
software

·         Quickly acquire the business domain and the terminology and data
models in use

·         Work within an Agile development process

REQUIRED:-

·         Bachelor's degree or advanced degree in Computer Science or related
field

·         2 years developing web applications using ASP.NET

·         2 years developing services using C#

·         2 years with JavaScript, jQuery, JSON, CSS, HTML, and XML

·         2-3 years working in an agile development environment unit testing
methods

·         Very strong relational database experience.

·         1-2 years Selenium Web Browser Automation experience.

DESIRED:-

Understand common design patterns and how to implement them

Solid understanding of software development process, including object oriented
analysis, design, and implementation.

Organized, detail oriented documentation skills.

Thanks and Regards,

Prashant Vishwakarma

Sr. Technical Resource Specialist | E-Solutions Inc. | Ext. 5117  No.
408-385-2354

2 North Market St. Suite #400 San Jose CA 95113

E: prashant.vk@e-solutionsinc.com

Gtalk: prashant.vishwakarma.3958@gmail.com

Subject: RE: .NET Developer position with Intel
Email Text:
Hi Theodore,

Here is the Job Description with additional notes:

Intel-8478

.NET Developer

Hillsboro, OR 97124

4 Months (Position may be extended after October)

Group: BUSINESS MANAGEMENT SOLUTIONS (30029)

Development and maintenance of an application dedicated to assisting the
performance testing and competitive analysis team to track performance metric
data..

Duties involve reviewing current state design and working with the technical
lead to define future state design, document, review, develop, test, and
implement product.

REQUIRED: Individuals should be experienced and proficient with Microsoft Visual
Studio (2012+ required), C#, .NET 4/4.5, ASP.NET 4, MVC 5, Entity Framework,
HTML, and JavaScript.

Unit testing experience is recommended.

Notes:

·         Seeking Web Developer

·         MVC Required (MVC 5 preferred)

·         Microsoft Visual Studio (2012+ required) – (currently using 2015)

·         C#

·         .NET 4/4.5

·         ASP.NET 4

·         HTML

·         JavaScript

·         Entity Framework (strong +)

·         No Minimum Education Required

·         Team size will be up to 11 people

·         Candidate must be adaptable to new environments/ doing code review/
recent 1 year experience is most important

Thanks.

(Dil) Dilnawaz Ashraf | Client Services Manager | netPolarity

Subject: RE: .NET Developer position with Intel
Email Text:
Hello Theodore,

I am sorry to hear you had a difficult time getting your resume submitted  to
this role. Here at NetPolarity we actually take care of the key words being on
your summary portion of the resume. Although, there is an uncertainty with this
particular role. Because it is with the same group as REQ # 8338 it may conflict
if you have been submitted to this group. We will double check to make sure so
you are not disqualified. In the meantime, go ahead and send us the RTR for 8478
so we have it ready in case it does not conflict and we are allowed to send you
in.

Thanks!

      Intel-8478

      .NET Developer

      Hillsboro, OR 97124

      4 Months (Position may be extended after October)

      Group: BUSINESS MANAGEMENT SOLUTIONS (30029)

      Development and maintenance of an application dedicated to assisting the
      performance testing and competitive analysis team to track performance
      metric data..

      Duties involve reviewing current state design and working with the
      technical lead to define future state design, document, review, develop,
      test, and implement product.

      REQUIRED: Individuals should be experienced and proficient with Microsoft
      Visual Studio (2012+ required), C#, .NET 4/4.5, ASP.NET 4, MVC 5, Entity
      Framework, HTML, and JavaScript.

      Unit testing experience is recommended.

      Notes:

      ·         Seeking Web Developer

      ·         MVC Required (MVC 5 preferred)

      ·         Microsoft Visual Studio (2012+ required) – (currently using
      2015)

      ·         C#

      ·         .NET 4/4.5

      ·         ASP.NET 4

      ·         HTML

      ·         JavaScript

      ·         Entity Framework (strong +)

      ·         No Minimum Education Required

      ·         Team size will be up to 11 people

      ·         Candidate must be adaptable to new environments/ doing code
      review/ recent 1 year experience is most important

Subject: In person interview confirmation for Theodore Seeber for data analyst/mapper position on Wednesday at 11:00 am PDT
Email in PDF: /Emails/All/2016-04-05-In person interview confirmation for Theodore Seeber for data analyst_mapper position on Wednesday at 11:00 am PDT.pdf
Attachments: 2016-04-05T09-34 [akansha.uxa@prodapt.com] In person interview confirmation for Theodore Seeber for data analyst_mapper position on Wednesday at 11:00 am PDT - invite.ics
Email Text:
Hi Theodore,
As we confirmed ,I am scheduling your in person interview with My hiring manager
tomorrow at 11:00am PDT

Interviewers name- Tim Schnitter ,Randy wood and Senthil G
Theodore Seeber contact number at 503-318-1508

Location - 7565 SW Mohawk St., Building M, Tualatin, OR 97062

below are the job details
Responsibilities:
  * Works within cross-functional teams to define source and target data stores
    for applications in the BSS/OSS stack.
  * Works with Client SMEs to define and record data mapping rules, value
    translations and validation requirements.
  * Assist ETL developer with comprehension and proper application of mapping
    definitions.
  * Meet regularly to understand expectations of and provide status to IT
    Management, business partners, and IT technical teams.
  * Manage tasks effectively and provide weekly progress status.
  * Cross team collaboration with all conversion teams
  * Work with teams to coordinate testing (System, E2E, User)
  * Coordinates with the project managers and team members of project
    deliverables, schedules, meetings, and ad hoc project report requests.
Qualifications:
  * 3-5 years of analysis and data mapping experience for Telecom applications
  * 5 years of experience working directly with business SMEs
  * Prior experience working with Telecom Network Information for mapping data
    from legacy systems to target systems
  * Excellent Verbal & Written Communication Skills
  * SQL experience (queries, joins, etc.) experience strongly desired
  * Experience with Data Profiling using SQL and other methods
  * Solid understand of data analysis techniques or processes
  * Ability to engage with senior management to assure assistance and
    satisfaction
  * Very strong data analysis & query skills

Thanks & Regards
Akansha Uxa
Sr. Technical Recruiter
(C) 281-409-7468

below are the job details
Responsibilities:
  * Works within cross-functional teams to define source and target data stores
    for applications in the BSS/OSS stack.
  * Works with Client SMEs to define and record data mapping rules, value
    translations and validation requirements.
  * Assist ETL developer with comprehension and proper application of mapping
    definitions.
  * Meet regularly to understand expectations of and provide status to IT
    Management, business partners, and IT technical teams.
  * Manage tasks effectively and provide weekly progress status.
  * Cross team collaboration with all conversion teams
  * Work with teams to coordinate testing (System, E2E, User)
  * Coordinates with the project managers and team members of project
    deliverables, schedules, meetings, and ad hoc project report requests.
Qualifications:
  * 3-5 years of analysis and data mapping experience for Telecom applications
  * 5 years of experience working directly with business SMEs
  * Prior experience working with Telecom Network Information for mapping data
    from legacy systems to target systems
  * Excellent Verbal & Written Communication Skills
  * SQL experience (queries, joins, etc.) experience strongly desired
  * Experience with Data Profiling using SQL and other methods
  * Solid understand of data analysis techniques or processes
  * Ability to engage with senior management to assure assistance and
    satisfaction
  * Very strong data analysis & query skills

below are the job details
Responsibilities:
  * Works within cross-functional teams to define source and target data stores
    for applications in the BSS/OSS stack.
  * Works with Client SMEs to define and record data mapping rules, value
    translations and validation requirements.
  * Assist ETL developer with comprehension and proper application of mapping
    definitions.
  * Meet regularly to understand expectations of and provide status to IT
    Management, business partners, and IT technical teams.
  * Manage tasks effectively and provide weekly progress status.
  * Cross team collaboration with all conversion teams
  * Work with teams to coordinate testing (System, E2E, User)
  * Coordinates with the project managers and team members of project
    deliverables, schedules, meetings, and ad hoc project report requests.
Qualifications:
  * 3-5 years of analysis and data mapping experience for Telecom applications
  * 5 years of experience working directly with business SMEs
  * Prior experience working with Telecom Network Information for mapping data
    from legacy systems to target systems
  * Excellent Verbal & Written Communication Skills
  * SQL experience (queries, joins, etc.) experience strongly desired
  * Experience with Data Profiling using SQL and other methods
  * Solid understand of data analysis techniques or processes
  * Ability to engage with senior management to assure assistance and
    satisfaction
  * Very strong data analysis & query skills

below are the job details
Responsibilities:
  * Works within cross-functional teams to define source and target data stores
    for applications in the BSS/OSS stack.
  * Works with Client SMEs to define and record data mapping rules, value
    translations and validation requirements.
  * Assist ETL developer with comprehension and proper application of mapping
    definitions.
  * Meet regularly to understand expectations of and provide status to IT
    Management, business partners, and IT technical teams.
  * Manage tasks effectively and provide weekly progress status.
  * Cross team collaboration with all conversion teams
  * Work with teams to coordinate testing (System, E2E, User)
  * Coordinates with the project managers and team members of project
    deliverables, schedules, meetings, and ad hoc project report requests.
Qualifications:
  * 3-5 years of analysis and data mapping experience for Telecom applications
  * 5 years of experience working directly with business SMEs
  * Prior experience working with Telecom Network Information for mapping data
    from legacy systems to target systems
  * Excellent Verbal & Written Communication Skills
  * SQL experience (queries, joins, etc.) experience strongly desired
  * Experience with Data Profiling using SQL and other methods
  * Solid understand of data analysis techniques or processes
  * Ability to engage with senior management to assure assistance and
    satisfaction
  * Very strong data analysis & query skills

Subject: Interview Details
Email Text:
Hi Theodore,

Congratulations on being selected for an In Person interview with Intel. Per our
conversation you are confirmed to interview on 08/30/2016 Tuesday at 03:00PM PST
for the Developer: Microsoft - III (ITEKJP00010443) position. Please reply back
confirming the details and your commitment to attend the interview.

Below are the details for the interview.

Job Title:                                   Developer: Microsoft – III

Date:                                          08/30/2016 Tuesday

Time:                                         03:00PM PST

Manager interviewing:            Peter Ittner

Job Code:                                 ITEKJP00010443

Address:                                   Jones Farm Campus, Building JF5
Address: 2111 N.E. 25th Avenue Hillsboro, OR 97124

Job Title: Developer: Microsoft – III

Location: Hillsboro, OR (97124)

Job duties of this position:

 The initial time period for this position is 6 months, with possible
extensions.

The assignment is to develop web applications and business intelligence reports
that interface with data warehouse and other data stores. The need is for a web
application developer with BI experience who will collaborate with stakeholders
and database experts to create business apps and interactive BI reports. The
related project also expects to support multiple groups with the created
apps/infrastructure, so the selected candidate with help grow the value of this.

Job Duties: The candidate will create/extend application code for web
applications, some of which will interact with SharePoint Business Intelligence
and Power BI. Candidate will also troubleshoot, debug, and correct problems
related to the collection and presentation of application data through existing
applications.

Required Skills: Strong development background in ASP.NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML,
CSS, and XML. Java experience is a plus. Demonstrable experience with SharePoint
BI or other Business Intelligence application(s).

Experience: Years of experience required for this position: 3-5 Years with
recent required skills and 7-10 overall experience with all tools.

Degree Type: BS in relevant field; CS, Engineering, etc.

Please reply me back over this email so that I can confirm your interview from
the manager end.

All the best for your interview.

Thanks & Regards

Mike

(: 734-928-2120

7:(734 927 9390)

*:mike@infotreeservice.com

Website:www.infotreeservice.com

Mailing Address:

215 Ann Arbor Rd.Suite 304  Plymouth, MI 48170

Follow Us On:

Subject: RE: Introduction
Email Text:
Hi Ted,

Great news-the hiring manager at Pacificorp would like to set up an interview
with you next Wed the 7^th at 1:30pm.  Will that work for you? This will be an

------ Attachment 1 Vacancy Letter.docx -----
                                                       March 27, 2015

Dear Sir/Ma’am:

       Selective Service System’s Region III Headquarters in Denver, Colorado has your
internet Local Board Member Inquiry information and I thank you for your interest. Our Board
Members are Selective Service System uncompensated employees who stand ready to render
decisions on cases of young men seeking deferment, exemption or postponement of military
service under any future return to conscription. They are appointed by the President upon
nomination from a State’s or Territory’s Governor.

       By law, Board Members may serve for a maximum of twenty years. Vacancies occur
when a Board Member completes twenty years of service, relocates, becomes unable or
unwilling to fulfill the position’s requirements, or voluntarily resigns. Consequently, vacancies
are unpredictable and may not occur for many years. If you desire consideration for a possible
Board Member vacancy, please complete the accompanying Selective Service System Form
404 and return it to us. We will maintain your information in our “Potential Board Member”
database and a Selective Service Reserve Officer will contact you when a vacancy becomes
available.

      Residents of Arizona and Kansas will also have to include a biography.

      We appreciate your interest in serving your country with the Selective Service System.

                                                       Sincerely,

                                                       John J. Wilber
                                                       Region Director

 California Background Sheet (CA)
 Minnesota Biographical Sheet (MN)

------ Attachment 2 LM Information Booklet.pdf -----
Board Member
 Information
   Booklet
                          VISION STATEMENT

The Selective Service will be an active partner in the national
prepardness community that anticipates and responds to the
changing nees of the Nation.

                       MISSION STATEMENT

The Selective Service System will provide trained and untrained
personnel to the Department of Defense in the event of a national
emergency. Also, the Selective Service System will provide an
Alternative Service Program for those from the manpower pool who
seek and are granted conscientious objector status.

                            CORE VALUES

Timeliness, fairness, equity, and respect for customers and co-
workers. Flexibility, creativity, and efficiency in the fulfillment of our
mission.

                                GOALS

•       Improve the Effectiveness and Efficiency of the
        Registration Process

•       Improve the Effectiveness and Efficiency of Personnel
        Delivery Processes

•       Improve the Effectiveness and Efficiency of Agency
        Support Processes
Thank you for your interest in the Selective Service System. The
following information is provided to give you a brief overview of
the Selective Service System in general, and the Board Member
Program specifically. This publication will not attempt to describe
the many facets of board functions and operations. A thorough
training program has been developed for this purpose and, if you
are selected, will be provided to you at a later date.

The Selective Service System is an independent Agency within
the Executive Branch of the Federal government. The legislation
under which the Agency operates is the Military Selective Service
Act (MSSA).

The MSSA, along with its implementing regulations, provides that
the structure of the Agency include a National Headquarters, a
State Headquarters in each state, and one each for New York City,
the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands,
and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.

The current structure of the Selective Service System also includes
three Region Headquarters. The National Headquarters and Region
Headquarters make up the contingency of full-time employees of
Selective Service. See Figure 1 below.

                 Figure 1 - Agency Structure
The Mission of the Selective Service is to provide manpower to
the Department of Defense for military service in the event of a
national emergency declared by the Congress or the President;
implement an Alternative Service Program for registrants classified
as conscientious objectors; and, maintain a program to conscript
health care personnel when directed. The all-volunteer armed
force, instituted in 1973, was never intended to stand alone in
time of emergency. In the event of conflict, the armed forces will
be quickly augmented by the National Guard and the Reserves. If
necessary, the Selective Service System will be mobilized to direct
registrants to the Military Entrance Processing Stations (MEPS)
around the country.

The first step to be taken in the event of a health care (i.e. Special
Skills Draft) or general conscription would be to conduct a lottery
to assign random sequence numbers to determine the order in
which registrants are ordered for an Armed Forces examination,
and if found qualified, inducted. If a registrant believes that he
qualifies for a deferment or exemption, he may file a claim with a
Selective Service Area Office. Receipt of such a claim will delay the
reporting date of the registrant until his claim has been adjudicated.
  Area Office                                 Alternative Service Office

    Local                   State
    Boards           Health Care Advisory               District
                         Committees                     Appeal
                                                        Boards
       District
       Appeal
       Boards                                     National
                                                 Health Care
                                                  Advisory
                                                 Committees
                          National
                          Appeal
                          Board

                  Figure 2 - Board Structure
Information explaining the process for claiming a postponement,
deferment or exemption will be available to registrants.

The MSSA and Selective Service regulations provide for the
formation of Local Boards, allocated according to county or
corresponding political subdivision. There is also a provision for
appeal boards to be established according to Federal judicial
districts. In addition, a National Appeal Board will be established.

The appeal boards act in cases of persons who do not agree with
the classification given to them by the Local Boards. In addition, the
District Appeal Boards will act on claims relating to job assignments
from Alternative Service Workers. All board members serve without
pay. Board Members are appointed by the Director of Selective
Service in the name of the President, upon the recommendation
of the Governor or comparable executive official. Board Members
must reside within the area served by the board to which they
are appointed. Under conditions requiring the induction of health
care personnel, Selective Service will create National and State
Health Care Personnel Advisory Committees comprised of medical
specialists and others to provide independent advice on national
and local health care issues to the Director, and to local and appeal
boards.

The law requires that the membership of each board be
proportionately representative of the race and national origin of the
registrants in the area it serves, to the maximum extent practicable.
Figure 2, on the previous page, identifies the Selective Service
System boards and health care advisory committees.

History has shown that of those registrants reporting daily to the
MEPS, approximately 50% will be found acceptable. Figure 3,
on the next page, illustrates the critical role accurate and prompt
decisions on requests for deferment and exemption play in the
operation of the entire system. If these decisions are not rapid
and fair, a great deal of inequity will result. Our board members,
representing the counties and local communities across the Nation,
will be called upon to make these decisions. These important
volunteer citizens are charged with protecting the individual rights
of all registrants presenting claims. Board members will make
significant judgments about each registrant’s claim for deferment or
exemption from military service.

                    Figure 3 - Induction Flow

There are two types of classifications. They are “Administrative” and
“Judgmental.” Administrative claims are either granted or denied by
compensated personnel assigned to an Area Office. If his claim is
denied, the registrant may request a review by his Local Board.
Judgmental claims will be brought before the Local Boards for initial
consideration. If his claim is denied, the registrant may request a
higher level review from the District Appeal Board.
The following is a list of the Judgmental Classifications:

       1-A-O Conscientious objector available for
             noncombatant military service only
       1-O   Conscientious objector to all military service
       2-AM Essentiality of Occupation (health care only)
       2-D   Deferred because of study preparing for the
             ministry
       3-A   Deferred because of hardship to dependents
       4-D   Minister of religion

You will note that the only difference between the health care
registrant classification identifier and that of the general registrant
is the M signifying “medical”, i.e., 3-AM.

There is no current requirement for the Selective Service System
to provide manpower to the Department of Defense. If and when
Selective Service is called upon to provide manpower, the integrity
and credibility of the entire conscription process will depend on a
fair and effective classification process maintained by highly able,
trusted and objective leaders in local communities.

 Accordingly, each Board Member will receive formal training in the
interpretation of Selective Service regulations for processing claims
submitted by registrants. One of the criteria for appointment is that
Board Members are willing and able to participate in the training
that Selective Service provides. Upon activation the skills acquired
during the training sessions will be utilized.

                                                         SSS Board Member Application

                                                    Personnel Policies and Procedures Manual - Chapter 520

   The Selective Service System (SSS) is seeking applicants to serve as uncompensated members of the SSS Boards. There is no plan to begin inducting
young men into military service at this time. Before inductions could be resumed, a law must be passed by Congress and approved by the President.
However, there is a need to make the SSS ready to operate should it become necessary. Consequently, it is necessary that we select and train citizens who
would be willing to serve if needed.

   Completing the attached information sheet does not obligate you to accept an appointment nor does it constitute an offer of an appointment. Each individual
selected for recommendation will be contacted to determine availability. This application is the first step in identifying individuals who are willing to serve as
SSS Board Members.

A. Eligibility Requirements: In order to be considered for appointment on a Board,

          1. You MUST:
                   a. be a citizen of the United States;
                   b. be at least 18 years of age;
                   c. reside in the county/borough/parish in which the Board has jurisdiction;
                   d. be able to devote sufficient time to accomplish Board Member duties;
                   e. be willing to apply the SSS law and Regulations fairly and uniformly; and
                   f. be registered with the SSS, if required to do so.
          2. You MAY NOT:
                   a. be an active or retired member of the Armed Forces or any Reserve Component;
                   b. have 20 or more cumulative years of prior SSS Board Membership;
                   c. be employed by public or private enterprise which handles SSS matters;
                   d. be a member of a law enforcement occupation as defined by SSS policy (example: police officer or judge);
                   e. be a SSS employee or a spouse of:
                               i. a compensated or uncompensated employee of the SSS;
                               ii. a Reserve Officer assigned to the SSS; or
                               iii. an appointee to any other SSS Board.
                   f. have been convicted, forfeited collateral, or are now under charges for a criminal offense, other than a traffic offense with only a
                   fine of $400.00 or less; except if a conviction is (1) older than 10 years (2) it was for a misdemeanor, and (3) you have since
                   displayed outstanding integrity in the community.

B. Appointment: Local Board Members are appointed by the Director after recommendation by the Governor of their State. District Appeal Board
   Members are appointed by the Director upon recommendation of a Region Director. Each SSS Board is composed of 5 members and membership of
   each Board should, to the maximum extent possible, be proportionately representative of the race and national origin of the Registrants within its
   jurisdiction. No citizen will be denied membership based on gender.

C. Selection: Individuals are selected by a process which begins with preliminary screening to determine whether the basic eligibility requirements are
   met. Personal interviews will be conducted with those persons found eligible. A prospective Board Member’s indication of willingness to serve by filling
   out the attached form is not a guarantee of a recommendation or a final commitment to serve. Each nominee will sign an Oath of Office and Waiver of
   Pay and receive written confirmation of appointment before serving as a Board Member.

D. Training: Each Board Member may receive approximately 5 hours of initial training in members’ duties and responsibilities, as well as continuation
   training consisting of 2 hours, which may be scheduled yearly. Board Members training may also be kept current by various mailings. If Board Members
   are unable to attend 3 consecutively scheduled training sessions, they will be asked to resign or will be removed from their position.

E. Responsibilities: Board Members are responsible for keeping abreast of changing regulations and procedures by attending training and meetings as a
   Board as scheduled, as often as necessary, to consider and decide on Registrants’ claim(s) for deferment, exemption or postponement of induction.
   Decisions of Local Boards are subject to appeal. Because Board Members are key to the success of the SSS, they are asked to attend all training
   sessions and Board meetings.

F. Remuneration: Board Members receive no pay for serving on the Board. They are, however, reimbursed for authorized travel expenses incurred while
   conducting SSS duties. This includes travel to required training sessions and to Board meetings. Remuneration will occur via Direct Deposit. Board
   Members do receive satisfaction knowing that they have had vital role in insuring that our nation’s defense manpower needs have been met in a just and
   impartial manner.

G. Application: If you meet the eligibility requirements in Section A and are interested in being considered for appointment, please complete the attached
   form and give it to the assisting official present or forward it to the appropriate SSS Region Headquarters indicated below. Locate your state
   abbreviation; this will designate the Region Headquarters address.

                                                       March 27, 2015

Dear Sir/Ma’am:

       Selective Service System’s Region III Headquarters in Denver, Colorado has your
internet Local Board Member Inquiry information and I thank you for your interest. Our Board
Members are Selective Service System uncompensated employees who stand ready to render
decisions on cases of young men seeking deferment, exemption or postponement of military
service under any future return to conscription. They are appointed by the President upon
nomination from a State’s or Territory’s Governor.

       By law, Board Members may serve for a maximum of twenty years. Vacancies occur
when a Board Member completes twenty years of service, relocates, becomes unable or
unwilling to fulfill the position’s requirements, or voluntarily resigns. Consequently, vacancies
are unpredictable and may not occur for many years. If you desire consideration for a possible
Board Member vacancy, please complete the accompanying Selective Service System Form
404 and return it to us. We will maintain your information in our “Potential Board Member”
database and a Selective Service Reserve Officer will contact you when a vacancy becomes
available.

      Residents of Arizona and Kansas will also have to include a biography.

      We appreciate your interest in serving your country with the Selective Service System.

Board Member
 Information
   Booklet
                          VISION STATEMENT

The Selective Service will be an active partner in the national
prepardness community that anticipates and responds to the
changing nees of the Nation.

                       MISSION STATEMENT

The Selective Service System will provide trained and untrained
personnel to the Department of Defense in the event of a national
emergency. Also, the Selective Service System will provide an
Alternative Service Program for those from the manpower pool who
seek and are granted conscientious objector status.

                            CORE VALUES

Timeliness, fairness, equity, and respect for customers and co-
workers. Flexibility, creativity, and efficiency in the fulfillment of our
mission.

                                GOALS

•       Improve the Effectiveness and Efficiency of the
        Registration Process

•       Improve the Effectiveness and Efficiency of Personnel
        Delivery Processes

•       Improve the Effectiveness and Efficiency of Agency
        Support Processes
Thank you for your interest in the Selective Service System. The
following information is provided to give you a brief overview of
the Selective Service System in general, and the Board Member
Program specifically. This publication will not attempt to describe
the many facets of board functions and operations. A thorough
training program has been developed for this purpose and, if you
are selected, will be provided to you at a later date.

The Selective Service System is an independent Agency within
the Executive Branch of the Federal government. The legislation
under which the Agency operates is the Military Selective Service
Act (MSSA).

The MSSA, along with its implementing regulations, provides that
the structure of the Agency include a National Headquarters, a
State Headquarters in each state, and one each for New York City,
the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands,
and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.

The current structure of the Selective Service System also includes
three Region Headquarters. The National Headquarters and Region
Headquarters make up the contingency of full-time employees of
Selective Service. See Figure 1 below.

                 Figure 1 - Agency Structure
The Mission of the Selective Service is to provide manpower to
the Department of Defense for military service in the event of a
national emergency declared by the Congress or the President;
implement an Alternative Service Program for registrants classified
as conscientious objectors; and, maintain a program to conscript
health care personnel when directed. The all-volunteer armed
force, instituted in 1973, was never intended to stand alone in
time of emergency. In the event of conflict, the armed forces will
be quickly augmented by the National Guard and the Reserves. If
necessary, the Selective Service System will be mobilized to direct
registrants to the Military Entrance Processing Stations (MEPS)
around the country.

The first step to be taken in the event of a health care (i.e. Special
Skills Draft) or general conscription would be to conduct a lottery
to assign random sequence numbers to determine the order in
which registrants are ordered for an Armed Forces examination,
and if found qualified, inducted. If a registrant believes that he
qualifies for a deferment or exemption, he may file a claim with a
Selective Service Area Office. Receipt of such a claim will delay the
reporting date of the registrant until his claim has been adjudicated.
  Area Office                                 Alternative Service Office

    Local                   State
    Boards           Health Care Advisory               District
                         Committees                     Appeal
                                                        Boards
       District
       Appeal
       Boards                                     National
                                                 Health Care
                                                  Advisory
                                                 Committees
                          National
                          Appeal
                          Board

                  Figure 2 - Board Structure
Information explaining the process for claiming a postponement,
deferment or exemption will be available to registrants.

The MSSA and Selective Service regulations provide for the
formation of Local Boards, allocated according to county or
corresponding political subdivision. There is also a provision for
appeal boards to be established according to Federal judicial
districts. In addition, a National Appeal Board will be established.

The appeal boards act in cases of persons who do not agree with
the classification given to them by the Local Boards. In addition, the
District Appeal Boards will act on claims relating to job assignments
from Alternative Service Workers. All board members serve without
pay. Board Members are appointed by the Director of Selective
Service in the name of the President, upon the recommendation
of the Governor or comparable executive official. Board Members
must reside within the area served by the board to which they
are appointed. Under conditions requiring the induction of health
care personnel, Selective Service will create National and State
Health Care Personnel Advisory Committees comprised of medical
specialists and others to provide independent advice on national
and local health care issues to the Director, and to local and appeal
boards.

The law requires that the membership of each board be
proportionately representative of the race and national origin of the
registrants in the area it serves, to the maximum extent practicable.
Figure 2, on the previous page, identifies the Selective Service
System boards and health care advisory committees.

History has shown that of those registrants reporting daily to the
MEPS, approximately 50% will be found acceptable. Figure 3,
on the next page, illustrates the critical role accurate and prompt
decisions on requests for deferment and exemption play in the
operation of the entire system. If these decisions are not rapid
and fair, a great deal of inequity will result. Our board members,
representing the counties and local communities across the Nation,
will be called upon to make these decisions. These important
volunteer citizens are charged with protecting the individual rights
of all registrants presenting claims. Board members will make
significant judgments about each registrant’s claim for deferment or
exemption from military service.

                    Figure 3 - Induction Flow

There are two types of classifications. They are “Administrative” and
“Judgmental.” Administrative claims are either granted or denied by
compensated personnel assigned to an Area Office. If his claim is
denied, the registrant may request a review by his Local Board.
Judgmental claims will be brought before the Local Boards for initial
consideration. If his claim is denied, the registrant may request a
higher level review from the District Appeal Board.
The following is a list of the Judgmental Classifications:

       1-A-O Conscientious objector available for
             noncombatant military service only
       1-O   Conscientious objector to all military service
       2-AM Essentiality of Occupation (health care only)
       2-D   Deferred because of study preparing for the
             ministry
       3-A   Deferred because of hardship to dependents
       4-D   Minister of religion

You will note that the only difference between the health care
registrant classification identifier and that of the general registrant
is the M signifying “medical”, i.e., 3-AM.

There is no current requirement for the Selective Service System
to provide manpower to the Department of Defense. If and when
Selective Service is called upon to provide manpower, the integrity
and credibility of the entire conscription process will depend on a
fair and effective classification process maintained by highly able,
trusted and objective leaders in local communities.

 Accordingly, each Board Member will receive formal training in the
interpretation of Selective Service regulations for processing claims
submitted by registrants. One of the criteria for appointment is that
Board Members are willing and able to participate in the training
that Selective Service provides. Upon activation the skills acquired
during the training sessions will be utilized.
