On Mon, Jul 21, 2025, 13:12 James Peterson <james.p@nleague.com> wrote:

  Hi Theodore ,

  We have an urgent requirement with the State of Indiana . We would like to
  forward your resume for the below job. Below is the job description for your
  reference let us know if interested in moving forward. Also, send us your
  recent resume to move forward with the submission process.

   Right to Represent Acknowledgement

   By confirming the email, please acknowledge below

    o I acknowledge and agree that nLeague Services Inc has the sole right to
      represent me in matters of work assignment relating to the State of
      Indiana’s Managed Services Provider Contract by submitting my professional
      resume to the Contract’s Managed Service Provider, Computer Aid, Inc. for
      the requirement identified below.
    o I also acknowledge and verify that all the information contained in my
      resume related to my technical credentials is accurate and is based on
      educational training and professional experience obtained throughout my
      career.
    o I also acknowledge and verify that the details included in the table
      located below, which pertain to my applicable years of experience for this
      specific position, reflect my actual work experience, and have not been
      embellished in any way.

  IN-IOT Senior Application Developer & Data Engineer (773122) – nLeague
  Services

   Candidate Name : Theodore Seeber

  Candidate Pay Rate for this Position:$___51_/hour.

  Candidate Employment Type if Selected for Engagement (W2, 1099, C2C) W2

  IN-IOT Senior Application Developer & Data Engineer (773122)

  Location: Indianapolis, IN

  Duration: 12+ Months

  100% remote

  The Indiana Office of Technology is seeking a skilled Senior Application
  Developer & Data Engineer with expertise in MuleSoft APIs, Azure Data Factory,
  and GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer services.

  Resource will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining
  various applications and systems to support our state agencies. This role also
  includes operations and support activities, such as fielding and resolving
  customer tickets and issues.

  Key Responsibilities

    o Application Development: Design, develop, and implement applications using
      MuleSoft APIs, Azure Data Factory, GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer
      services, additional cloud ETL services, data pipelines, and application
      development technologies.
    o Knowledge of data quality principles and experience with data governance
      practices.
    o Software Development Lifecycle: Participating in all phases of the SDLC,
      including requirements gathering, design, development, testing,
      deployment, and maintenance.
    o Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop, and maintain efficient and
      scalable data pipelines and ETL processes that collect, process, and store
      data from various sources.
    o Data Modeling and Architecture: Design and implement robust data models
      that enable efficient data analysis and manipulation
    o System Integration: Integrate various systems and applications to ensure
      seamless data flow and interoperability.
    o Programming: Develops and codes new application software and/or make
      enhancements to existing application software.
    o Testing: Tests and debugs new and existing application software,
      generating comprehensive unit test data, and validating test results.
    o Customer Support: Field and resolve agency customer tickets and issues in
      a timely and efficient manner. Resolves customer issues with application
      software and responds to suggestions for improvements and enhancements.
    o Data Quality and Governance: Implement data quality checks, ensure data
      integrity, and contribute to data governance policies.
    o Project Support: Confers with management to assist in planning,
      organizing, and controlling the activities of assigned areas. Assists
      state staff and vendors on various development projects and contributes to
      Agile and SDLC project management in assigned areas.
    o Maintenance and Support: Provide ongoing maintenance and support for
      existing applications, data pipelines, and systems.
    o Operations Activities: Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues,
      and ensure optimal performance of applications and systems.
    o Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all
      applications, systems, and integrations.
    o Collaboration: Work closely with other developers, system administrators,
      and stakeholders to ensure successful project outcomes.
    o Compliance: Ensure all applications and systems comply with state policies
      and regulations.
    o Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers and data
      engineers, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented environment.

  Please Note:  All the candidates must clear the background check for all State
  positions. Thank you.

  Attention: **Please feel free to forward this job to your friends, colleagues,
  and family members who would be looking for a new excellent opportunity to
  work for a State contract position.  A Referral Bonus will be provided if the
  candidate is placed**

  Best Regards

  James Peterson

  5975 Shiloh Road, Suite 114, Alpharetta, GA 30005

  678-325-0303 | Fax: 800-268-1754

  james.p@nleague.com | www.nleague.com

Email Text:
Hi Ted,
Totally understood, and you’ve made a fair point. Not being able to reapply
funds without confirmation of a refund is absolutely reasonable, especially
given everything you've already committed to this project. I wouldn't expect you
to stretch further without knowing where things stand financially.
That said, in light of the refund delays from Upwork and the need to keep the
work pipeline from freezing up completely, I’ve set up a secure Skrill account
to test a faster, more flexible payment channel. Just a small $50 test run will
help confirm if this works as a viable route not just for you, but for other
clients too.
Here’s the link:
👉 https://skrill.me/rq/MOSES%20OGBU/50/USD?key=wCEBcNXK-f9zRI0uWXZrmz0vOm3
No pressure, if it doesn’t process properly, I’ll return it right away. This is
purely a test, not another financial burden. You're already deep into the
journey, and I’m just looking for a practical way to ensure we keep making
progress without being stalled by platforms.
Let me know your thoughts.
ONMAH MOSES
SHRM - CERTIFIED RESUME SPECIALIST (SHRM-CRS)

    Hi Ted,
    I completely understand your concern, and I want to be very transparent
    about the current situation on my end.
    Unfortunately, due to the unexpected suspension of my Upwork account, I'm
    unable to access our project history or initiate the refund directly from my
    dashboard, as you've already noticed, the order and contract are no longer
    visible on your side either. This is part of Upwork’s policy when one party
    is flagged or under review.
    That said, I’m not giving up not on your project and not on doing what’s
    right. Since I can’t trigger the refund manually, the only viable
    alternative now is for you to initiate a chargeback or dispute directly with
    Upwork or your bank.
    💳 How to initiate a chargeback through Upwork:
    1. Go to your Upwork transaction history:
    https://www.upwork.com/ab/reports/transaction-history
    2. Search for the payment related to the contract with me.
    3. Click on "Report a problem" or "Dispute a charge", and explain that the
    freelancer's account is now suspended and a refund could not be processed.
    4. If that doesn’t work or isn’t visible, contact Upwork support directly
    via:
    https://support.upwork.com
    Or email: support@upwork.com
    5. Alternatively, reach out to your credit card provider and request a
    chargeback for services not delivered. Since you paid through a secure
    channel, your provider may reverse the charge if Upwork can't intervene.
    Again, I deeply regret how this played out. I genuinely hoped this
    collaboration would take you to your next big opportunity, and I still
    believe you deserve it. If there's any other way I can assist from outside
    Upwork  whether in forwarding your documents, helping with strategy, or
    consulting, I remain available.
    Thanks again for all the trust you placed in me.
    Warm regards
    ONMAH MOSES

            properly, but this also triggered issues with any credit card or
            banking method I connected. The platform flagged unusual activity,
            especially after the bonus of $12,000 on a $280 contract, which
            appeared disproportionate and raised compliance concerns on their
            side.

            keep your project running using other available resources, actually
            covering parts of the work with trusted team members’ funds because
            of the confidence I have in the value we’re creating for you. But
            now those resources need to be settled, and I wanted to be upfront
            with you.

Subject: Re: Ted Seeber Job Search Info
Email Text:
Hi Ted,
Thanks for the heads-up regarding the new regulations, I completely understand
how complex and frustrating things are getting on your side. Let’s set the
Skrill option aside for now and focus on the necessary steps forward.
At this point, it might be best to proceed with initiating the chargeback
through Upwork, as that would allow you to regain your funds securely and
without any further back-and-forth. Once that’s sorted, we can re-strategize
based on your comfort and availability.
Let me know once you’ve taken that step or if you’d prefer I walk you through
the process.
ONMAH MOSES
SHRM - CERTIFIED RESUME SPECIALIST (SHRM-CRS)
On Tue, Jul 22, 2025, 11:18 PM Theodore Seeber <seebert42@gmail.com> wrote:

  New laws have gone into effect for services such as Skrill.  I need to submit
  documentation before I can deposit to my Skrill account to prevent money
  laundering.  The United States is getting really strict on this point, in
  advance of our conversion from dollars to stablecoin.
  On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 3:06 PM Onmah Moses <onmahmoses@gmail.com> wrote:

    Hi Ted,
    Totally understood, and you’ve made a fair point. Not being able to reapply
    funds without confirmation of a refund is absolutely reasonable, especially
    given everything you've already committed to this project. I wouldn't expect
    you to stretch further without knowing where things stand financially.
    That said, in light of the refund delays from Upwork and the need to keep
    the work pipeline from freezing up completely, I’ve set up a secure Skrill
    account to test a faster, more flexible payment channel. Just a small $50
    test run will help confirm if this works as a viable route not just for you,
    but for other clients too.
    Here’s the link:
    👉 https://skrill.me/rq/MOSES%20OGBU/50/USD?key=wCEBcNXK-f9zRI0uWXZrmz0vOm3
    No pressure, if it doesn’t process properly, I’ll return it right away. This
    is purely a test, not another financial burden. You're already deep into the
    journey, and I’m just looking for a practical way to ensure we keep making
    progress without being stalled by platforms.
    Let me know your thoughts.
    ONMAH MOSES
    SHRM - CERTIFIED RESUME SPECIALIST (SHRM-CRS)

      On Tue, Jul 22, 2025 at 2:38 PM Onmah Moses <onmahmoses@gmail.com> wrote:

        Hi Ted,
        I completely understand your concern, and I want to be very transparent
        about the current situation on my end.
        Unfortunately, due to the unexpected suspension of my Upwork account,
        I'm unable to access our project history or initiate the refund directly
        from my dashboard, as you've already noticed, the order and contract are
        no longer visible on your side either. This is part of Upwork’s policy
        when one party is flagged or under review.
        That said, I’m not giving up not on your project and not on doing what’s
        right. Since I can’t trigger the refund manually, the only viable
        alternative now is for you to initiate a chargeback or dispute directly
        with Upwork or your bank.
        💳 How to initiate a chargeback through Upwork:
        1. Go to your Upwork transaction history:
        https://www.upwork.com/ab/reports/transaction-history
        2. Search for the payment related to the contract with me.
        3. Click on "Report a problem" or "Dispute a charge", and explain that
        the freelancer's account is now suspended and a refund could not be
        processed.
        4. If that doesn’t work or isn’t visible, contact Upwork support
        directly via:
        https://support.upwork.com
        Or email: support@upwork.com
        5. Alternatively, reach out to your credit card provider and request a
        chargeback for services not delivered. Since you paid through a secure
        channel, your provider may reverse the charge if Upwork can't intervene.
        Again, I deeply regret how this played out. I genuinely hoped this
        collaboration would take you to your next big opportunity, and I still
        believe you deserve it. If there's any other way I can assist from
        outside Upwork  whether in forwarding your documents, helping with
        strategy, or consulting, I remain available.
        Thanks again for all the trust you placed in me.
        Warm regards
        ONMAH MOSES
        SHRM - CERTIFIED RESUME SPECIALIST (SHRM-CRS)
